availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Jackson Hendrick (Warren County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Petty Hendrick in Warren County, Kentucky, on March 18, 1839. Father of James A. Hendrick, Joseph V. Hendrick, Robert W. Hendrick, John A. Hendrick, Nancy E Hendrick, Thomas M. Hendrick, William A. Hendrick, and Charles M. Hendrick. Resident of Warren County in 1840. Farmer in Butler County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States(1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, p. 52.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Butler County, p. 258A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 76.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Lucus Precinct, p. 223A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 14616.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film 000164009.
"William Jackson Hendrick (1818-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 99768612, accessed July 6, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99768612 .
